description.plain:
Joel Adams is a Brisbane-born pop-soul singer/songwriter, who is best known for his self-released single “Please Don’t Go” released in 2015, when he was 2015. He was born Joel Goncalves on December 16, 1996 family of music lovers, and got his start in music at 11-years-old, listening to artists such as James Taylor, Al Green, and Led Zeppelin..

He originally participated in the final day of auditions of X Factor Australia, though making it past the live auditions, he, unfortunately, was sent home before the live shows. Though he admits that:

Not making it to live shows was the best thing that ever happened to me."

Two years later the auditions took place, he adopted his mother’s maiden name as his stage name and Adams took the next step by launching a YouTube channel where he uploaded his weekly covers of pop hits. Later on, after his single had successfully debuted, Adams moved to the United States and began working with a number of producers on his debut album, for which Adams had already written 30 plus songs for. Adams describes America as a “grand prize for musicians”

Joel Adams is a Brisbane-born pop-soul singer/songwriter, who is best known for his self-released single “Please Don’t Go” released in 2015, when he was 2015. He was born Joel Goncalves on December 16, 1996 family of music lovers, and got his start in music at 11-years-old, listening to artists such as James Taylor, Al Green, and Led Zeppelin..

He originally participated in the final day of auditions of X Factor Australia, though making it past the live auditions, he, unfortunately, was sent home before the live shows. Though he admits that:

Not making it to live shows was the best thing that ever happened to me."

Two years later the auditions took place, he adopted his mother’s maiden name as his stage name and Adams took the next step by launching a YouTube channel where he uploaded his weekly covers of pop hits. Later on, after his single had successfully debuted, Adams moved to the United States and began working with a number of producers on his debut album, for which Adams had already written 30 plus songs for. Adams describes America as a “grand prize for musicians”

songs.full_title: Please Don't Go by Joel Adams
songs.title: Please Don’t Go

description.plain:
“Please don’t go” is a single that was debuted by Australian singer Joel Adams. It was officially released on November 2, 2015, and has peaked at  #55 in Australia. The song was able to chart the top 100 on Official Weekly Music Charts in 15 countries, peaking highest in Sweden at #6. The song was certified Platinum in Denmark after reaching 90,000 plus sales. The 19-year-old Joel Adams says of his song:

We’re charting globally on Spotify. I thank my fans, my team, and God.”

There are two remixes of “Please Don’t Go.” One was remixed by Tschax, the other was remixed by Norelli.

Adams also had the honor of performing “Please Don’t Go” live on The Morning Show in Sydney on April 1, 2016.

The music video corresponding to the song was released in the following month on Decmeber 23, 2015. As of July 2018, the video has gainned 62 million views on Facebook and YouTube combined.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S2oxFIsENgM

songs.title: Please Don’t Go (Nightcore)

songs.lyrics:
57 ContributorsPlease Don’t Go Lyrics[Intro]
Hmm, hmm, hmm
Hmm, hmm, hmm
Hmm, hmm, hmm
Hmm, hmm, hmm
Hmm, hmm, hmm
Hmm, hmm, hmm
Hmm, hmm, hmm

[Verse 1]
Nobody ever knows
Nobody ever sees
I left my soul
Back then, no I'm too weak
[Pre-Chorus]
Most nights I pray for you to come home
Praying to the lord
Praying for my soul

[Chorus]
Now please don't go
Most nights I hardly sleep when I'm alone
Now please don't go, oh no
I think of you whenever I'm alone
So please don't go

[Verse 2]
Cause I don't ever wanna know
Don't ever want to see things change
Cause when I'm living on my own
I wanna take it back and start again

[Pre-Chorus]
Most nights I pray for you to come home
I'm praying to the lord
I'm praying for my soul

[Chorus]
Now please don't go
Most nights I hardly sleep
When I'm alone
Now please don't go, oh no
I think of you whenever I'm alone
So please don't go
You might also like[Bridge]
I sent so many messages
You don't reply
Gotta figure out, what am I missing babe?
Singing now, oh oh oh
I need you now, I need your love, oh

[Chorus]
Now please don't go
I said most nights I hardly sleep
When I'm alone
Now please don't go, oh no
I think of you whenever I'm alone
So please don't, (please) don't go
So please (please) don't go
(Please) don't go, oh no
So please don't go
I think of you whenever I'm alone
So please don't go32Embed

songs.title: Fake Friends

description.plain: This song, completely based on friendship wheel. Which turned out to have a person leaving his friend for someone/body that was unknown for no apparent reason

songs.embed_content: Read “Fake Friends” by Joel Adams on Genius

body.plain: This song, completely based on friendship wheel. Which turned out to have a person leaving his friend for someone/body that was unknown for no apparent reason

songs.lyrics:
10 ContributorsFake Friends Lyrics[Verse 1]
Lately, you and I can't even hold a conversation
It's like I'm talking to a wall
I hear that, that you've been running around
And telling everyone you hate me
Somehow I didn't even know
And I've been talkin' to your mama
She said, "Boy, it's such a shame."
She knows that I was always there, nah nah
So tell me who the hell are them, nah nah
[Pre-Chorus]
You're rollin' through the hills to the fake parties
Buyin' all those drinks with your fake ID
Hangin' with your friends but your friends ain't me
But you can say I said "Hello"

[Chorus]
Say "Hello" to your fake friends
Hope I don't meet them someday
Never there when you need them
But you still love them the same
I guess you can't be alone
Not even for one day
So say "Hello" to your fake friends
Say "Hello"
Say "Hello"

[Verse 2]
You hit me up in the middle of the night
But we haven't talked all day
You tell me, "I'm out of money and I need to get a ride
My friends are headed out, it's late"

[Pre-Chorus]
You're rolling through the hills to the fake parties
Buying all those drinks with your fake ID
Hanging with your friends but your friends ain't me
But you can say I said "Hello"

[Chorus]

songs.title: Coffee
songs.embed_content: Read “Coffee” by Joel Adams on Genius

album.full_title: Joel Adams - EP by Joel Adams
album.name: Joel Adams - EP

songs.lyrics:
6 ContributorsCoffee Lyrics[Verse 1]
I drink the coldest coffee in the morning
Wake up for a girl who never loved me
Thinking that she feels something, but it's hopeless
Counting down the months before this one leaves
'Cause baby only leads me on, every night
Got me holding open crooked doors, faded lines
Rules she makes for me to please her soul
But she'll leave whenever she fucking likes

[Chorus]
So I've been drinking coffee in the morning just to wake up
(Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh)
'Cause caffeine thanks my mind and keeps me breathing
Through her fake love (Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh)
Can't be in the right, she burns me every time
Thought that I'd be patient, but I just can't take her spite
So I've been drinking coffee in the morning just to wake up
(Ooh, ooh)
[Verse 2]
I hold on to the love we used to share together
Tied in with the good times we both had
Now we're slowly fading I know, more now than ever
She could never take me back the way I am
And every night is miserable, I can't forget
All the memories I counted on when we made love
All the moments when she held me close
Now I know I'll never see that girl again
